column4: That Ubuntu installation went quite smooth - had to hack my XF86Config in order to use the nvidia module a bit, but that was all so far. :)
(I switched a few hours ago from debian to ubuntu)

The only thing that I don't like atm. are the old version of X-Chat and Firefox. Should I just stay at warty and wait until it is made available for that repository or does it make sense to go with the "bleeding edge" ?
don't know about xchat, but there's a backport of firefox at ubuntu-bp.sourceforge.net
